item.description:
Join us and Somerville Mayor Joseph A. Curtatone for the annual Somerville Spring Cleanup this Saturday, April 27, 2013 from 9 a.m. – noon at several locations throughout town (arrive at 8:30am if you'd like coffee and light breakfast bites). A fun BBQ lunch will be available starting at 12 noon.

Our site: The Healey School, 5 Meacham St, Somerville

Our site contact: Lee Dwyer (with Groundwork Somerville)
Email: lee@groundworksomerville.org

Yum! Following the Cleanup, all participants are invited to attend the SomerGreen Festival, at the Blessing of the Bay Boat House on Shore Drive (across the road from the school) from 12 noon to 2:00 p.m. The Festival will feature a community BBQ, opportunities to learn about agricultural and green initiatives, a scavenger hunt and other family-friendly events along the Mystic River. This is also a good chance to get in on the ground floor of Urban Agriculture in the City!

Parking/Directions by T: When facing the school, there is a parking lot to the right where you are welcome to park.

If coming by T, from Sullivan Station take either the 101 bus for a 9 min ride, or the 89 or 95 bus for an 11 min ride.

The annual cleanup is sponsored by Comcast, who is partnering this year with the environmental nonprofit Groundwork Somerville for a cleanup at three additional sites. Participants will receive a complimentary t-shirt and light snacks. Bring water, extra snacks if you'd like, and clothes you don't mind getting dirty. A rain date has been set for Sunday, April 28. Anyone is welcome - looking forward to seeing you there!

Last questions? Email Lee lee@groundworksomerville.org (or write a comment below). Reminder email to follow on Friday with Lee's cellphone # such that you can access her if lost.

The Boston Volunteers

Big enough to deliver, small enough to care

Learn More: www.BostonVolunteer.org

Connect with us:
item.how_to_find_us: The Healey School, 5 Meacham St, Somerville - parking lot to the right of school when facing building

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Somerville Spring Cleanup: school yard garden prep & planting
